content.description:
15 meters of steep ice leads to a lower angle ramp weaving its way up and left to a small pillar of ice. A great warm up and very enjoyable climb.

The furthest line right.
A rack of screws. Tree anchor.

Interesting climbing on a series of curtains and pillars constantly leading up and left. Top out on nice ledge with brilliant turf shots through spongy moss. Dreamy.


Furthest line left on the Sea Monster ice flow.
A rack of screws. Tree anchor.

climbs.name: Kraken
climbs.fa: Sam Jones, Joe Kennedy and Greg Hughes

content.description:
Climb the most obvious central line of gorgeous ice. 20 meters of near vertical ice leads to a lower angle section narrowing into a gulley at the top.

Found in the middle of the wall.
A rack of screws. Tree anchor on top.

Fantastic climb on the far left hand side of the wall. The first pitch is mostly rock following a diagonal crack system up to a large ledge. Belay below an extremely narrow pillar that widens as it nears the top. Climb the short but stout pillar to the top of the plateau. Find a tree and belay.

On the far left hand side locate a diagonal crack to leads up and right to a big ledge.
Single rack to 2" piece and a rack of screws.

A splendid climb up an intricate, technical line of rock and ice. Good gear when you need it most.

Start about 50 feet left of the main ice flow on the wall. Look for a corner crack system that trends up and right to ice.

A light rock rack with a few pins and a rack of screws.Â

Lots of cool features on this fairly reliable climb that faces north. Pitch1 has fun steep climbing on cool features. Pitch 2 is a bit of a let down with low angle ho hum to the trees.

Located a very short distance from the Sea Monster wall. To access it is best to walk downhill to the brook and then downstream about 50 meters. Look up through the trees and you should see a wide greenish colored waterfall.
A rack of ice screws. Tree anchor at the top.

Take the line just left of the Kraken, a long steep column that leads to a lower angle flow. Quite sustained.

Found left of center in the Sea Monster ice wall.
A rack of screws. Tree anchor.

Fun, easy meandering line up a narrow gully, best done via simu climbing in one long pitch. The first 250 feet is WI2/3 ice followed by steep snow and frozen moss. This line will take you right to the top of the plateau. Set up a belay when it gets reasonably flat.

Located just around the corner from the Triton snowfield up another slope leading up and left.  Follow the slope up until you see a narrow flow of ice on your right.
A few screws. Tree anchor.

climbs.name: Triton
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Mike Delaney and Annette Boerlage

content.description:
Begin on a thin verglassed slab and work your way up and right to a steep, fat pillar that leads to a Pine tree.

Located just 40 meters downstream from One Green Line on the same side of the drainage is a broad 50 degree snowfield that leads to a gulley and a wall of ice. Triton is the first line encountered on the left as you go up the gulley.
A rack of ice screws. Tree anchor.

climbs.name: Ventura Highway
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Joe Kennedy and Sam Jones

content.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

This area faces northeast so it gets very little sun making for very reliable ice throughout the season. Located down the valley about half a mile from the main lookoff on the west side of the canyon.
